body.p: The Divvun tools for InDesign has earlier only supported InDesign CS3 due to lack of support for newer versions of InDesign from our subcontractor. But with the release of CS5.5, InDesign supports the same proofing tools as OpenOffice, which Divvun has supported in a Beta version for many years. This also means that we will support Windows users the same as we support Mac users, as the proofing tools are exactly the same.
Below you will find installation instructions for both InDesign CS3 and InDesign CS5.5. CS4 and CS5 is not supported, and will never be supported.

section.title: InDesign CS3
section.p: The InDesign CS3 proofing tools components are built on the same technology and architecture as the proofing tools for MS Office. There is a separate page documenting how the hyphenation works.
Proofing tools for InDesign CS3 are provided for both North, Lule and South Sámi. They work only with the Macintosh version of InDesign. They require InDesign CS3 - nothing newer, nothing older.

section.title: Installation
section.p: In the instructions below, the text <InDesignFolder> refers to the folder containing the installed InDesign application, usually /Applications/Adobe InDesign CS3/.

ol.li: The downloaded .dmg file should automatically open in a new window - if not, double-click the .dmg file.

Copy the following files to the <InDesignFolder>/Plug-Ins/ folder — an alias to that folder is provided, just drag and drop the plug-ins on the alias:
PldHypSamiLule.InDesignPlugin
PldHypSamiNorthern.InDesignPlugin
PldSplSamiLule.InDesignPlugin
PldSplSamiNorthern.InDesignPlugin
Copy the folder Polderland to the <InDesignFolder>/Plug-Ins/Dictionaries/ folder. An alias is also provided for this folder, just drag and drop.

ul.li: Mac: simply follow the installation instructions above, and replace the old files with the new ones when asked. If it doesn't work, first deinstall (see the next point), then install anew.
Mac: just move the installed files and folder to the thrash.

section.title: Hyphenator
section.p: The known issues for the InDesign hyphenators are the same as for the MS Office hyphenators, unless otherwise noted. There are a few known hyphenation issues - for an up-to-date listing, have a look at the open hyphenator bugs in our Bugzilla.

section.title: Speller
section.p: Presently there are a few known speller issues specific to InDesign - which relate to the use of the user dictionary - but none such that they are critical to regular and full use of the speller.

ul.li: changes in UDC/UDR are not immediately reflected in the document (e.g. a word just added to the AddedWords stays red underlined until either a change is made to or near it (e.g., type a space after it) or the document is rechecked.
removing a word from RemovedWords list is not reflected on the screen immediately (functionality is OK, but displayed list on the screen is not updated).
NonWords (words that are in the .lex but also in the RemovedWords list (on disk as UsrDicNon)) are not considered before the RemovedWords list is opened explicitly by user

section.title: InDesign CS5.5
section.note: The InDesign CS5.5 support is in alpha stage at the moment. There are some issues with commpounds in the speller, we have no hyphenator, and there is no automatic installer. A full release is planned for April 1.

you do not need to add the country code, only the ISO 639 language code is enough. That is: se for North Sámi, smj for Lule Sámi, and sma for South Sámi.
make sure the files have correct owner, group and permissions. It should be root:admin, and read-only for all.

section.title: Usage
section.p: Proofing for Sámi works exactly as for any other language. Follow the InDesign instructions for turning on automatic hyphenation and continuous spell checking, and select one of the languages Sami: Northern, Sami: Lule or Sami: Sout (for CS3) / Northern Sámi, Lule Sámi or South Sámi (for CS5.5) in the language list. The text will reflow, with hyphens automatically inserted where needed, and misspellings will be marked with a red underline.
